website_summaries.verdict: One of the only solid wood options around. Built to last. Sturdy and strong, even with rough children.
pros: The wood construction uses solid pine which makes the bed extremely durable to hard impacts and scratches
cons: Limited space underneath makes it difficult to create a bottom living space

customer_reviews.title: No MDF
customer_reviews.text: This bed shipped fast. It arrived a head of schedule, in a damaged box. However, it was in great condition, complete and very well packed. It is a two person job to put it together, but it a pretty simple process. Its sturdy and looks nice. I actually have two of these, one dark, one light. One is just the bed (purchased here), the other is all the add on's (purchased second hand). My kids love it, they like to have a cave to hang out in. It is wood, no MDF or plywood. Its not a hard oak, but it is much better quality captain or loft bed then I was able to find in my area
customer_reviews.author: Us Moore

customer_reviews.title: Don't be skeptical, it really IS great!
customer_reviews.text: I put this bed together about halfway on my own, then had some help from another person to complete it, and it was fairly easy to do. The pieces were all in new condition, nothing was missing or damaged. My son lost his mind with excitement when he saw his new bed and is especially thrilled about making a fort out of the open space under it. It's very spacious, fit my 6 and 4 year olds comfortably together when they wanted to do a "sleepover" on it. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: MissyCee

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for small spaces with low ceilings.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this bed for my daughter when we moved. The ceilings were low so we couldn't have a standard loft, and it's an old house so it's a small room. This is perfect because it is an efficient use of the space. She loves the little play area under neath the bed; she's created a little fort under there with simple fabric from the store. The bed is nice and sturdy, we didn't even anchor it to the wall. It was a quick 1/2 hour setup with 2 pair of mechanically inclined hands. For those less inclined, I would estimate about an hour start to finish. Bottom line, great bed for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 🥃

customer_reviews.title: Kids loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a bunk bed with the bottom bunk being on the floor. Plenty of room for my 3 year old to sit up on her bed on the bottom with the plush mattress we have. I put it together by myself and it took about an hour or so with the tools provided. I didn’t put the extra screws into the slats that didn’t have predrilled holes so that it would be easier to take apart it we need to move it out and it still is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan M

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves his new 'cool bed' he got for his birthday and thanks me multiple times a day for it. He's now excited to crawl into bed and doesn't cry for us to lay down with him at night. It was assembled in under 2 hours with 2 adults and 1 toddler 'helping'. Instructions were straightforward. No damage in the shipping process. Color is much prettier in person than pictures. Sturdy. Comes with an Allen wrench for assembly, but we also used a drill for the slats. My son and I fit on the bed comfortably for story time and cuddles. SO MUCH ROOM FOR ACTIVITIES!
customer_reviews.author: Robin La La

customer_reviews.title: Ours Came Broken
customer_reviews.text: Ours came broken, one of the boards was split and one of the posts split when I was fastening a screw. Being able to see the quality of the wood, without the varnish on it, showed just how poor the whole thing was manufactured. After more inspection the real issue wasn't quality control but quality of the product. I wouldn't recommend taking a chance on the product, especially since it is for your child. I opted for a refund rather than a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: trooso

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly rickety...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly rickety. Definitely do not trust this bed at all to hold anything more than 50lbs. If you're looking for a sturdy bed, this is NOT the one for you. If there's any movement, the whole bed shakes and the dowels that hold the rails together clank and wake you up. If it wasn't such a pain in the ass to put together a d take apart, this would have gone back that next day.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Now excited for bedtime!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old's big brother just upgraded to a big bunk bed and we needed something for the little one that was fun but safe. This bed was the perfect size. He still feels like it's a "brand new bedroom" but I have no worries he's going to take a tumble from a tall ladder. The design of this bed not only made the room look more organized but it's inspired my little one to keep his room clean (since nothing can be hidden under the bed!). Solid construction and easy instructions. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: erin pennell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and the pieces are not cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the quality for the price! Easy to assemble and the pieces are not cheap quality. I bought shower tension rods and made some curtains to hang from underneath. I also bought a 2x3 Closetmaid cube organizer with 3 of the soft bins to serve as a bookshelf and it fits perfectly underneath. My husband also put some rope lighting as well. My son loves his bed! Only gripe is that it is a little shaky when on top, definitely don't recommend climbing into bed with your kid on top unless you are tiny.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cruz

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sons 7th birthday. He absolutely loves it! The quality is very good and not bad to put together. Took about an hour. We bought some rope lights for under the bed, a loft bed skirt from walmart, some bean bags and it made a great little reading area or just a nice spot for some alone time. Would recommend! First one ups damaged but Amazon was great with a replacement and a new one came by fedex with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bed for the price
customer_reviews.text: We are really happy with this bed, I don't think we could find a better one for the price. It took some work to put it together but only because there was lots to do, not because it was confusing. We did switch the ladder to the other end and my husband had to drill an extra hole but other than that it went really well. The bed is quite solid and it's a beautiful colour. It does have a strong smell for the first few days but I thought it smelled like wood, not chemicals as others have claimed. Overall we really like the product, our daughter loves the under space and we highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: kbean

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed!
customer_reviews.text: We got this bed for our almost 4 year old. While he still doesn't want to sleep in his own room all night every night, he does really like this bed. Gives him a nice little cave where his little chair sits and his toy box is under it too. Along with more room in the rest of the room. I tried to start putting it together by myself and didn't read the directions right, which ended in an almost catastrophe. But my husband got home and saved the day by fixing it and all is well. Bed is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kalissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed! It took my 10 y/o son and I about two hours to build. The instructions are easy to follow and the bed is easily assembled, we did need an extra person at the end to help hold up one side so we could connect them but other than that, it was smooth sailing. We created a tent in the storage space underneath and my daughter is over the moon about it. I highly recommend this bed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy bed.

I guess "standard twin" tends to run small so the first mattress we bought was way too small. Ended up with a Serta Twin that fits nicely even though I wish it was a little longer it was the closest we could find to the right size.

The slats seem very weak and the holes for the slats did not line up at all and the other holes (two sets for the slats) were non-existent. I am too weak to screw the screws in so I have to use a power screw driver which is not stated. It's an OKish bed. I personally wouldn't recommend it though if you're the one putting it together. Eh.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bed. Sturdy

Thought we would need an extra bracket under each corner based on reviews however that was not necessary. Paint scratches and gouges easily but was expected based on price. Smells like new wood. Very pleased.

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!

I can even still lift him into the bed when he's fallen asleep elsewhere. It did require some extra tightening after a few weeks of uses but since then it's held together well. I also flipped the ladder as others have but that means you need to drill new holes to accommodate. No bid deal when you have someone who knows what they're doing.

I like that it is not too high. The only thing that was frustrating is that it says you can move the stairs to the other side, but then there is no hole to move the peg to the other side. So the stairs have to stay where they are or you have to try to drill into the wood yourself. I have not done it yet because I am worried about not getting the hole straight and going through the side of the thin piece of wood.

I was give fireplace tv mount instructions with a remote. Not helpful. Luckily the directions are posted on another website so you can google it. It was very easy to put together and seems to be pretty sturdy. This definitely is a space saver.

product_meta.title: Canwood Whistler Junior Bed-Espresso Loft, Single
product_meta.description: Lower than a traditional Loft or bunk bed, but still elevated from the floor, The canwood Whistler Junior Loft bed is the ideal first “big kid” bed for your child. Featuring a securely fastened ladder and full-length guardrails, the canwood Whistler Junior Loft bed is designed to fit a standard twin size mattress (not included), and is made with high-quality pine wood and composites and metal-to-metal fastening systems for added stability. Maximize space-saving convenience by utilizing the area underneath the Loft for more storage, or transform it into a fort or reading nook (only canwood Whistler Junior Loft bed Included). for safety reasons, due to the elevated Height of this unit, please ensure that your child is ready to transition to sleeping in a loft-style bed unit. Canwood furniture products are exclusively manufactured by Stork craft.
feature_bullets: The ideal first "big kid" Bed for your child, the canwood Whistler Junior Loft bed is lower than a traditional loft bed but still elevated from the floor.
Featuring a securely fastened ladder, and full-length safety guardrails.
Designed to fit any standard twin-size mattress (mattress not included).
Constructed with high-quality solid rubber wood and composites, and metal-to-metal fastening Systems for added stability.
